comment.author: 73835404@N00
comment._content: I have a comment about the translation of "Mar De Plata"  to "River Plate". Another translation is Silver Sea or River Silver or Silver River. To translate it to River Plate doesn't translate the correct meaning. The meaning of the words Mar De Plata is The Silver Sea.

comment.author: 35310696@N04
comment._content: Thank you for your comment. I have changed the caption to Mar De Plata.

comment.author: 11967758@N00
comment._content: Hi, I'm an admin for a group called **I love Argentina** (Post 1 Award 3), and we'd love to have this added to the group!

comment.author: 52580665@N03
comment._content:
[http://www.flickr.com/photos/lesabrisabri] [http://www.flickr.com/photos/field_museum_library] 
I have to tell you, that the name is "Mar del Plata" and it´s a city in Argentina, so, you DON`T have translate. We have a footbal team that is called "River Plate", but you CAN`T translate the name of the cities. 
By the way, is "Mar deL Plata" with an "L" at the end of the middle word.

Greats from Argentina!
